segments.text: I notice the water pouring over the sink, and it’s getting worse by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on that plate, like it’s the only thing that matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy stretching for the cookie jar, and I’m terrified he’s going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and he doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting, like this is all normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the kitchen is going to be ruined by the time anyone does anything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is already pooling around the woman’s feet, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the scene looks from the outside with that garden view.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to pull the whole cabinet down if he’s not careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole situation is just ridiculous and dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR
